item.title: List in Pintos
item.description: Pintos is a simple Linux OS for the course CS140. It’s designed to help understand some important functions of OS, including threads, virtual memory and file system. Though it’s very simple compared to the real linux kernel, it still can run an real x86 simulator. This post is about an important data structure list in the src/lib/kernel/list.c, which is used massively in the pintos project. But its design usually made it easy to confuse the people at first, so it’s very interesting to look into its implementation. Some Background Since Standard C doesn’t provide dynamic list library, it’s up to developers to decide how to implement the list when they need to use it.
